title: 9News Adelaide | Tuesday January 27 | Full Episode
description: South Australia is sweltering under a record-breaking heatwave as Adelaide endures its hottest night in history. In this bulletin, we cover the impact of the searing temperatures on local businesses and power grids, plus the excitement and challenges of students returning to school in 40-degree heat.  Beyond the weather, we bring you the latest on a violent teen assault in Elizabeth Downs, a family home destroyed by fire in Gillies Plains, and a significant breakthrough in the Middle East as the final Israeli hostage's remains are recovered from Gaza.   CHAPTERS:  0:05 Record-breaking heatwave across SA  3:35 Teen assaulted in Elizabeth Downs  4:36 Heroic dog rescue from Gillies Plains fire  6:12 Thousands of students return to school  8:31 Suspicious blaze destroys home in Elizabeth East  8:48 Violent road rage attack in Lockleys  9:08 Armed robbery at Woodville North service station  9:28 Final Israeli hostage remains recovered from Gaza  11:22 Critical Meningococcal case in Adelaide  11:42 Victor Harbor glassing attempted murder charge  12:18 Inflation data and interest rate looming decision  14:14 One Nation surges in latest political poll  15:30 De Minaur faces Alcaraz in tennis quarter-final  16:39 Fatal light plane crash on the Gold Coast  18:51 Music teacher pleads guilty to student abuse  20:31 Bomb scare charges following Perth rally  | *Subscribe and ðŸ””: http://9Soci.al/KM6e50GjSK9*  *Get more breaking news at 9News.com.au: http://9Soci.al/iyCO50GjSK6*  FOLLOW 9News Australia â–º Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/9News/ â–º Twitter: https://twitter.com/9NewsAUS â–º Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/9news/  Join 9News for the latest in news and events that affect you in your local city, as well as news from across Australia and the world.  #9News #BreakingNews #NineNewsAustralia #9NewsAU

title: 9News Brisbane | Tuesday January 27 | Full Episode
description: Tonight on 9News Queensland with Melissa Downes and Joel Dry, we lead with a devastating light plane crash at Jacobs Well on the Gold Coast that has claimed the lives of a veteran pilot and his friend. Investigative teams are on-site at the smoking wreckage to determine what caused the home-built aircraft to go down shortly after takeoff. Meanwhile, a major flood emergency is unfolding in North Queensland, where the town of Einasleigh has been inundated after record rainfall caused rivers to rise at a staggering rate of one meter per hour. Residents have been forced to flee to higher ground as emergency services struggle to reach isolated communities. title: Today in History: Challenger Space Shuttle Disaster | 9 News Australia
